intro: Paraboea obtusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a bluish-green color. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
